meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or fooled.
meanings.sent1: The scam artist targeted unsuspecting dupes in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a dupe after falling for the fake lottery win.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the gullible dupe who bought a bridge online.
meanings.sent4: He realized he was a dupe in the grand scheme of the con artist's plan.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the main character as a lovable dupe who always believed in others.

meanings.sent1: The con artist dupes people by promising them riches.
meanings.sent2: She tried to dupe her friend into thinking the broken vase was an accident.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick successfully duped the audience into believing the impossible.
meanings.sent4: His smooth talk dupes many into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The clever disguise dupes even the most cautious of observers.

meanings.definition: A duplicate or copy of something.
meanings.sent1: She made dupes of the important documents for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a dupe of the famous painting to display in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a dupe of the key hidden in the suspect's pocket.
meanings.sent4: The backup drive contains dupes of all the files for emergencies.
meanings.sent5: The store sells dupes of designer handbags at a fraction of the cost.
